BasicDescription.Title: Despatch Box
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Political discussion analysing the day's events in Parliament.

BasicDescription.Title: From Here To Modernity
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Kirsty Wark documents the decline of Modernist architecture, through to Post-Modernism and the heritage movement.

BasicDescription.Title: Open Advice
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Staying On Course: When studying with the OU, the choice of course is all important. Students reveal how they are making the big decision.

BasicDescription.Title: Pause
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Three Stages Of Learning: Professor Charles Handy talks about the three phases of working life that he thinks many people go through.

BasicDescription.Title: Sydney: Living With Difference
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. In just twenty years, Sydney has transformed itself from an outpost of the British Empire to one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the world.

BasicDescription.Title: PSHE: Dear Nobody
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Secondary Schools. Berlie Doherty's acclaimed novel about school-age pregnancy.

BasicDescription.Title: PSHE: Alison
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Secondary Schools. A light-hearted but moving look at a young couple's first sexual encounter.

BasicDescription.Title: Japanese Language And People
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Languages. Eating, Drinking And Entertainment: Introduction to the language, culture and everyday life in Japan.

BasicDescription.Title: Japanese Language And People
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Languages. Time Out: Introduction to the language, culture and everyday life in Japan.

BasicDescription.Title: Working For Yourself
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Using The Internet: Practical guides, top tips from users and a look at basic email packages, plus a look at browsers and search engines, news services and saving and printing sites.

BasicDescription.Title: Velocity Diagrams
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. How diagrams showing a component's speed can help to solve engineering problems.

BasicDescription.Title: Digital Being: Spontaneity
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. Human life forms in the digital age - and spontaneity.

BasicDescription.Title: Cybersouls
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Open University. When we can talk across continents and enter virtual realities, could the human body eventually become redundant?

BasicDescription.Title: Rotten Ralph
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The Point Of No Return: Ralph pesters his family to rent out the new Bongo Bob video, but the fines soon start to mount up when he forgets to return it to the shop.

BasicDescription.Title: Smurfs' Adventures
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The First Telesmurf/Handy's Kite: Only three apples high, they live in mushroom houses and take their morning showers with dew drops. But with Gargamel around, no-one is safe.

BasicDescription.Title: Woody Woodpecker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Temper Temper/Legend Of Rocky Point/Crash Course: More spooky nonsense and fun with Woody and his pals Wally Walrus, Buzz Buzzard, Chilly Willy and Winnie Woodpecker.

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Catch up with the latest happenings and the juiciest gossip from the Academy.

BasicDescription.Title: Blue Peter
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Simon joins Bishop Willy Pwaisiho as he returns to the Solomon Islands where he is chief to people once thought to be the most warlike in the South Pacific. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: The Wayne Manifesto
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Amy Pastrami: Violet's back from America and her stories of 'Amy Pastrami Day' ignite the imagination of the drama teacher.

BasicDescription.Title: Clifford The Big Red Dog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Clifford And The Beanstalk: When Jetta lands the lead role in the school play, she learns the hard way that hard work and preparation are the things that make you successful.

BasicDescription.Title: Doctor Otter
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Colour Me Lucky: The Donfuss children find a brightly coloured chameleon called Lucky in the woods. Though he isn't very good at hide a seek, Doctor Otter soon finds him a new role.

BasicDescription.Title: Andy Pandy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. The Picnic: There is great excitement in the garden when Looby Loo plans a picnic. However, while helping, Teddy manages to break her plates. Luckily, Andy Pandy has a solution.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Treasure Chest: Florrie finds a treasure chest, which she takes to a secret hiding place. But then the chest mysteriously disappears. W/S. Followed by Teletubbies Count To Christmas.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: Fimbles Activity / Sticker Book

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies Count To Christmas
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. A magic Teletubbies moment in the style of an Advent Calendar on a count down to Christmas Day.

BasicDescription.Title: Pingu
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies: Pingu And Pinga Stay Up: More fun with the intelligent but rather clumsy and occasionally misunderstood loveable penguin.

BasicDescription.Title: Tweenies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. The Circus: Max visits the circus to find out about life in the circus, and meets some talented friends.

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Silvie's Fish Pond: Dipsy follows a cloud that makes a puddle of rain. When his hat falls in the puddle, he sings a sad song, but when the sun dries his hat, Dipsy sings a happy song.

BasicDescription.Title: Birthdays
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Will your birthday card be among today's colourful selection?

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Megamaths
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Fractions. Tenths And Decimals: The Fraction Numberline Tightrope and Freddie the Fraction Frog show the Maths Man the similarities between tenths and decimal fractions.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Look And Read
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Spywatch. Captured: The children go to the quarry at night and discover Grainger's secret.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Science Zone
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Changes In Materials. A Rusty Tale: While Vicky gets to grips with a rusty VW Beetle, we look at how rust develops, and see how rust is a benefit to sculptor, Sophie Ryder.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Focus
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 9-11] Citizenship. Minorities. A Home From Home. Refugees: Though Britain provides a safe haven, the arrival of asylum seekers has also produced a strong wave of hostility against them.

BasicDescription.Title: Schools: Primary History
BasicDescription.Synopsis: [Age 7-9] Roman Britain. Gods, Games And Goodbye: An investigation into the Romans, with a look at the origins of Rome, the conquest of Britain and everyday life in the towns and countryside.

BasicDescription.Title: Working Lunch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Business, consumer and workplace news from the award-winning team who tell it like it is. With Adrian Chiles, Adam Shaw and roving reporter Rob Pittam.

BasicDescription.Title: Teletubbies Everywhere
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Carousel (France): Round and round the world we go! New adventures away from Teletubbyland using song and dance to help pre-schoolers say Eh-Oh to numbers and words.

BasicDescription.Title: Higher And Higher
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Musical starring Frank Sinatra. Unable to pay his servants, a bankrupt spendthrift attempts to secure a wealthy marriage for his kitchen maid, by passing her off as his debutante daughter. [1944, b&w]

BasicDescription.Title: Westminster Live
BasicDescription.Synopsis: An update on the day's events in Parliament, plus your chance to question the politicians. Phone 0345 514614 [local rate], fax 020 7973 6283 [national rate], or email west.live@bbc.co.uk.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Followed by regional news and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Animal Park
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Ben Fogle from Castaway and Kate Humble explore life behind the scenes at Longleat Safari Park. Comet the lioness is off to Newquay zoo, while vet Duncan Williams, tackles Benzi the ostrich.

BasicDescription.Title: Ready Steady Cook
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Take top chefs Kevin Woodford and Tony Tobin, add two contestants, throw in some ingredients and garnish liberally with Ainsley Harriott. Simmer and enjoy.

BasicDescription.Title: The Weakest Link USA
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Nine contestants play as a team but only one will survive to reach the prize. Who will make it through the questions and survive Anne Robinson's barbed comments?

BasicDescription.Title: The Simpsons
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Twenty Two Short Films About Springfield: The lives of Springfield residents are highlighted in a series of interconnecting stories.

BasicDescription.Title: Fresh Prince Of Bel Air
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Will Goes A Courtin': When Will refuses to pay rent until his air-conditioner is fixed, Philip takes the matter to court.

BasicDescription.Title: Buffy The Vampire Slayer
BasicDescription.Synopsis: All The Way: It's Halloween and while Anya ropes everyone in to help at a Magic Box sale, Dawn takes advantage of the hectic situation, and slips away on a mission of her own.

BasicDescription.Title: Time Flyers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Lost Avenue: The Time Flyers team travels back 6,000 years to the spectacular stone circle at Avebury, and recreates what happened to the huge stones that made up the avenue.

The Lost Avenue
The Time Flyers team travels back 6,000 years to the spectacular stone circle at Avebury, part of the Stone Age complex in Wiltshire that includes its famous older brother, Stonehenge.
Recently, archaeologists have uncovered a completely new avenue leading away from the Avebury stone circle. From the air the whole layout is made clear, including the mark in the crops that first hinted at the existence of a forgotten avenue. The Time Flyers team joins the dig excavation to search for some of the buried stones that once made up the avenue. They also ask whether the avenue was used for funeral rites and what Avebury's relationship to Stonehenge might be. It's a story of pagan rituals, druids and cutting-edge archaeological science as the team recreate what happened to the huge stones that made up the avenue.

BasicDescription.Title: Home Front In The Garden
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Hemel Hempstead: Diarmuid Gavin creates a gentle but magical garden for a family recently arrived from New Zealand, featuring an undulating wooden path through a bog garden.

BasicDescription.Title: Have You Remembered What...
BasicDescription.Synopsis: ...Not To Wear? Rose: London cab driver Rose put up a struggle when Trinny and Susannah tried to get her out of her jeans. A year on, Rose is still driving her cab, but what's she wearing?

BasicDescription.Title: Horizon
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Day The Earth Nearly Died: 250 million years ago, 95% of all life on Earth was wiped out. The cause has long remained a mystery. Horizon investigates the day the earth nearly died.

The Day The Earth Nearly Died
It was the mother of all catastrophes. 250 million years ago, 95% of all life on Earth was wiped out in the greatest disaster our planet has ever experienced. Yet the cause of this cataclysm has long remained a mystery. No one knew what had done it, or whether it could happen again. Now, Horizon can reveal what really happened on the day the Earth nearly died.
It occurred in an era long before the dinosaurs, when strange, half-forgotten reptiles roamed the Earth. It was as complete a world back then as ours is today. Then, the fossil record shows, everything died out in a geological instant.
When palaeontologists looked for the reason, they could find almost nothing. The Permian killer had left no fingerprints. But there were a few clues. There were signs that the entire continent of Siberia had caught fire in massive volcanic eruption, filling the atmosphere with greenhouse gases. In the Antarctic there were hints of a meteor the size of Manhattan. Perhaps the Permian creatures had met the same fate as the dinosaurs.
But a trip to Greenland may have finally revealed the truth. It seems that there was not one Permian killer, but two, including a strange and terrifying force from deep within the oceans.

BasicDescription.Title: Look Around You
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Brain: Examining what happens when a thin metal probe is inserted into a subject's brain to stimulate an area known as the broab. How does this affect his mental state?

BasicDescription.Title: The League Of Gentlemen
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Anarchy In Royston Vasey: Tubbs and Edward leave the sanctuary of the Local Shop in search of a 'no-tail', and Les McQueen is astounded that Creme Brulee have reformed, without him.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Video: The League of Gentlemen Christmas Special DVD

BasicDescription.Title: Newsnight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In-depth investigation and analysis of the stories behind the day's headlines.

BasicDescription.Title: Mega Mela Revealed
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A special behind the scenes look at the Mega Mela Awards Show, with exclusive interviews with stars and winners on the night. Presented by Sonia Deol and Harkirn Bahra.
